intro: Stylagrostis leiopoda, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed sandalwood, is a small shrub native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round fruits. Its botanical features make it an important species in its native ecosystem, though it is relatively rare and faces threats from habitat loss.
